questions.question: 1. Two compounds can have exactly similar mass spectra.

explanations.a: The small compound occurs during fragmentation are different in both the cases. Fragmentation is based on the functional groups present in the molecule.

answers.a: When hydrogen atom removed from the molecule
answers.b: When electron is added to the molecule
answers.c: When electron is removed from the molecule
answers.d: Removal of CH&#8322 group from the molecule

explanations.a: It will generate anion, which possesses a negative charge on the molecule. It wonâ€™t be useful in mass spectrometry for molecular mass descrimination or molecular mass identification.
explanations.b: It will also generate anion and is not useful in  mass spectrometry.
explanations.c: Only cations formed after electron removal are used in mass spectrometry to identify the molecular mass of a new molecule.
explanations.d: Every molecule may not contain CH&#8322 group in it.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following is NOT the method of ionization?

explanations.b: All the other options (a, c, and d) can forcefully kick-out an electron from the molecule, where absorption is the term related to capturing of compound by another material.

explanations.d: Parent ion peak is of heaviest ion (the one with the greatest m/z value), where base peak has 100% abundance.
